title: Resurvey of 895 acres of Antarvedi temple land ordered
content: Nestled between Godavari river and Bay of Bengal, the Sri Lakhsmi Narasimha Swamy temple has 895 acres of land on record

title: City-level convention bureaus must be formed to tap into MICE potential, says tourism official
content: Suman Billa, Director-General in the Union Ministry of Tourism, says hosting the G20 Summit proves that the country did not just have the infrastructure but ability to hold such world-class events

title: A.P. sets Guinness World Record for organising world’s largest PTM
content: The event witnessed a total footfall of 1.5 crore attendees, including parents, teachers, students, alumni, school management representatives and school management committee members, besides philanthropists, according to Guinness World Records officials

title: First verdict in rape cases against Prajwal Revanna expected on July 30
content: The case concerns a 48-year-old woman who was working as a help at the family’s Gannikada farmhouse in Hassan and was allegedly raped twice and the act recorded by the accused on his mobile phone

title: Torrential rain disrupts life across Bengal; Teesta overflows, landslides in north, house collapses in Kolkata
content: Heavy rainfall triggered by low-pressure in Bay of Bengal; major disruptions in transport and communication, IMD issues alert till August 4

title: Debris clearing work on Kochi-Dhanushkodi National Highway complete
content: Public Works department’s National Highway wing completes work and it is expected that traffic will be resumed on the stretch by Wednesday once the District Geologist submits a report

title: Wild elephant captured in N.R. Pura taluk of Chikkamagaluru district
content: Officials bring four tamed elephants from Sakrebailu camp in Shivamogga to help them in the operation

title: Plan for immediate and long-term needs of Wayanad landslides-hit families sees progress
content: Micro plans were prepared for each family affected in the the Mundakkai-Chooralmala landslides, says the Minister for Local Self-Governments

title: People urged to stay alert as water continues to be discharged from Tungabhadra dam
content: The district administration suspends vehicular movement on the Kampli-Gangavati bridge which is already submerged in the river waters

title: Dead fences and crumbling walls, Kerala’s prisons vulnerable to more breaches
content: The escape of life convict Govindachamy from Kannur Central Prison has exposed lapses in Kerala’s prison security system, where outdated infrastructure and administrative inertia have long gone unaddressed.  Chronic underfunding and poor interdepartmental coordination have been cited as key reasons delaying much-needed security upgrades of prison facilities

title: July 30: a cup of memories, a dash of hope
content: Noufal Kalathingal’s cafe, named July 30, at Mepadi town echoes both pain and purpose for him. It is a tribute to the 11 members of his family, including his wife and three children, he lost in the Wayanad landslides.

title: Local bodies told to ensure a ‘green Onam’
content: ‘Haritha Onam’ will be incorporated in the branding of Onam celebrations by local bodies across the State this year.  A door-to-door campaign to create awareness on waste management will be carried out with Mahabali presented as the ‘King of Cleanliness’

title: Farmers displaced by Greenfield highway project warn of escalated protest if grievances remain unsolved
content: A ‘Chalo Eluru Collectorate’ protest will be held on August 4 urging the government to provide fair compensation, construction of service roads, and underpasses with adequate height and width, says A.P. Rythu Sangham State assistant secretary

title: Nagaland cabinet to discuss Centre's directive on creation of frontier territorry: Minister
content: ENPO, the apex organisation representing eight tribes across six districts – Mon, Tuensang, Longleng, Kiphire, Noklak, and Shamator – has been demanding separate statehood since 2010, citing “decades of neglect in governance and development”

title: YSRCP to launch App for reporting ‘harassment and injustice by officials’
content: They will be stored in a digital library, which will be opened once our government comes to power, and those responsible will be brought to justice with interest, says Jagan Mohan Reddy;  he alleges that kickbacks are reaching the MLAs and even the Chief Minister’s family

title: Move on HPV vaccine rollout to adolescent girls raises other vaccination priorities for Kerala: epidemiologists
content: ‘Incidence of cervical cancer has been on a steady decline in the State over the past several years and it no longer figures among the top five cancers affecting women in Kerala’

title: Govind Rao panel to assess development in Kalyana Karnataka region next month
content: It will ascertain the number of taluks that are backward, more backward and most backward and also examine various aspects of development

title: GMC standing committee approves development works worth ₹21 crore
content: The committee discusses and approves 63 proposals related to infrastructure and civic amenities after detailed deliberations with elected representatives and departmental heads

title: Overgrown vegetation stifles ‘Oxygen Park’ at Ponmalai
content: A total of 1,050 of Beema Bamboo saplings were planted in the park in September 2022 to provide green cover to Ponmalai where a number of railway employees live

title: NCLT admits Blu-Smart Mobility for insolvency resolution
content: Catalyst Trusteeship files petition against Blu-Smart for default, NCLT appoints IRP, dismisses other petition, admits Gensol Engineering for insolvency

title: Amit Shah must take responsibility for ‘security lapse’ at Pahalgam: Mallikarjun Kharge in Rajya Sabha
content: Kharge attacked the government citing Jammu and Kashmir Lt Governor Manoj Sinha's statement admitting to the security lapses that led to the terror attack.

title: Parts of Eluru town to face power outage on July 30
content: The power supply will be interrupted from 2 p.m. to 5 p.m. to facilitate the construction of new 11-kV feeder lines on Chataparru road, according to a press release

title: In Lok Sabha, Rahul Gandhi questions political will behind Operation Sindoor
content: Rahul Gandhi accused the government of undermining the morale and effectiveness of the armed forces by imposing limitations

title: Two-day Young Indians Parliament concludes in Mysuru
content: Young Indians and CII organise a two-day event that allowed students to understand the intricacies of parliamentary procedures, debate and exchange ideas

title: Discharge into the Kollidam crosses 1 lakh cusecs
content: The officials of the Water Resources Department said the water flow at the Upper Anicut is likely to increase to 1.40 lakh cusecs and then start dwindling depending on the release of water from Karnataka

title: Naidu invites Singapore companies to invest in Quantum Valley
content: Chief Minister also highlights State’s potential for data centre development and the necessary ecosystem available in Visakhapatnam, during a high-profile meet with industrialists and business leaders of the Southeast Asian nation

title: Works on Handri-Neeva completed to transfer 3,850 cusecs through main canal, says Nimmala Ramanaidu
content: The NDA government has achieved in  one year what the previous YSRCP dispensation could not in five years, he says

title: Panjapur-Kudamurutti road: residents protest against proposed eviction
content: The protesters said some of the residents had been living in the area for over 40 yeasr and were in possession of valid records besides being prompt in paying property tax

title: Students told to pursue goals with determination and strategic planning
content: Sri Srinivasa Mines and Minerals chairman Mogatadakala Srinivasa Rao emphasises the importance of drawing inspiration from iconic personalities such as M. Harischandra Prasad and J.R.D. Tata during an event held to commemorate the two industrialists at Sir C.R. Reddy College

title: Keralite nuns’ arrest in Chhattisgarh: bipartisan protests roil Kerala for third consecutive day
content: The demonstrations over the arrest of sisters Preeta Mary and Vandana Francis of the Assisi Sisters of Mary Immaculate order, hailing from Kannur and Angamaly respectively, also radiated out to Chhattisgarh

title: Madras High Court steps in to safeguard twin foetuses of surrogate mother
content: Justice N. Anand Venkatesh takes upon himself the task of issuing ‘parentage order’ that should otherwise be issued by a magistrate before commencing surrogacy process

title: No leader of any country asked India to stop Operation Sindoor: PM Modi in Lok Sabha
content: The Prime Minister said Pakistani airbases hit by India “are still in ICU” and the masterminds of the April 22 terror attack continue to have sleepless nights

title: Catholic priest issues  guidelines for nuns in North India to avoid hate attacks
content: The Catholic Church welcomes the advisory issued by Fr. Suresh Mathew, former editor of Indian Currents and a priest based in Punjab. The advisory follows the arrest of two Assisi Sisters of Mary Immaculate (ASMI) nuns at Durg Railway Station in Chhattisgarh on July 26 over allegations of human trafficking and religious conversion

title: IMF upgrades India’s FY26 & FY27 growth forecast to 6.4% in line with global growth uptick
content: However, the report also noted that, although the July prediction for global growth is higher than the one made in April, it is still lower than the 3.3% growth seen in 2024 and the pre-COVID-19 pandemic historical average of 3.7%.

title: Police disallow large gatherings at Nellore jail and Nallapureddy’s residence during Jagan’s visit on July 31
content: Nellore Rural and Town police officials have allowed 15 vehicles, including three of the organisers, during the entire programme; YSRCP alleges that the government is imposing unnecessary curbs on the visit

title: No decision to update National Population Register: Govt in Lok Sabha
content: The Minister was asked if the government notified the intention to conduct the NPR update prior to the Census-2027.

title: Deputy Commissioner stresses need for robust market for fish produced in Mandya
content: The district produces 30,000 tonnes of fish annually, the official noted in a district-level commitee of Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana

title: Singapore reaffirms commitment to Amaravati and A.P. development; Naidu hails move
content: Minister Tan See Leng expresses his country’s interest in working closely with Andhra Pradesh on key projects, recalls earlier role in capital city infrastructure design and development assistance

title: Provisional award letters given to all selected candidates under National Overseas Scholarship: govt.
content: Earlier this month, the Social Justice Ministry had asked 66 selected candidates from SC and DNT backgrounds to wait for award letters, to be issued ‘subject to availability of funds’

title: Vehicular movement banned from Hondarabalu check-post to K. Gudi till September 27
content: Ban ordered in view of the development works taken up on selected sections of Nanjangud-Biligiri Rangana Betta or B.R. Hills road

title: NISAR mission would showcase Indian space engineering on a global scale: Ex-ISRO scientist
content: “NISAR is one of the key missions that will garner large-scale operational user feedback from across the globe,” Ex-Project Manager of NISAR said

title: Centre pegs 9.4% growth in FY26 cess, surcharge collections at ₹5.91 lakh crore
content: This is higher than FY25 cess and surcharge collection of ₹3.87 lakh crore and ₹1.53 lakh crore, respectively

title: China has not intruded even an inch into Indian territory since 1962: Rijiju in Lok Sabha
content: “It is important to correct the record. Since 1962, China has not intruded even an inch into our territory nor occupied any additional land. This fact must be made clear,” Mr. Rijiju said

title: Defence Ministry signs MoU with TIDCO to set up testing facility in Defence Corridor in Tiruchi
content: Set up under the Defence Testing Infrastructure Scheme (DTIS), up to 75% funding is provided as ‘grant-in-aid’ with 25% funds raised by the Special Purpose Vehicle

title: Synod of Orthodox Church expresses anguish over persecution of Christians
content: The synod condemns the attack on the two Keralite nuns by religious extremists and their subsequent arrest on charges of human trafficking and forced religious conversion

title: Sri Lankan Navy arrests 14 Indian fishermen
content: Five fishermen who were on board a mechanised boat and nine fishermen who were aboard a country boat were held

title: Operation Sindoor discussion: Nadda apologises to Kharge, takes back his words
content: J.P. Nadda accused Mallikarjun Kharge of "losing his mental balance" as he made some remarks against Prime Minister Narendra Modi

title: Farmers’ organisation moots scheme to pump surplus Cauvery water to tanks in Karur district
content: Cauvery Padugai Farmers Federation says  government should implement a project to link 14 tanks in Kulithalai, Thogamalai, and Krishnarayapuram blocks of Karur district and divert surplus Cauvery water into them

title: Eugenio Suarez to where?! The one trade our experts would make before the deadline
content: A late-arriving trade season? No problem -- we asked our MLB experts for the one fun, outside-the-box deal they'd make to get things moving along.

title: MLB trade deadline updates, rumors: Division rivals eye Luis Robert
content: Which contenders will make the biggest splash? Here's what we're hearing as 6 p.m. ET on July 31 approaches.

title: NYC shooter was targeting NFL HQ, mayor says
content: A gunman who killed four people at a Manhattan office building was trying to target the headquarters of the NFL but took the wrong elevator.

title: Cubs Hall of Famer Sandberg dies at age 65
content: Ryne Sandberg, a Hall of Fame second baseman who spent nearly all of his playing career with the Cubs, died Monday after a recurrence of cancer.

title: Source: Colts' Raimann signs 4-year, $100M deal
content: Left tackle Bernhard Raimann has signed a contract extension with the Colts, which a team source confirmed is worth $100 million over four years.

title: 'It was a no-brainer': Paul celebrated in L.A. return
content: Eight years after he last played for the franchise, Chris Paul was reintroduced as a member of the Clippers on Monday, calling his return to Los Angeles a "no-brainer."

title: D-backs 3B Suárez hit on hand, X-rays negative
content: D-backs All-Star Eugenio Suárez hopes he avoided a major injury when he was hit on the right index finger by a pitch on Monday.

title: Deion says he's cancer-free after bladder removal
content: Colorado coach Deion Sanders said he recently had surgery to remove his bladder after doctors found a tumor there, and he declared that he has been cancer-free since the operation.

title: Sources: Harper cussed out Manfred in meeting
content: Bryce Harper told MLB commissioner Rob Manfred to "get the f--- out of our clubhouse" during a meeting with the Phillies about the game's economics, sources told ESPN.

title: Source: Raiders player offended by Wilkins' kiss
content: Christian Wilkins, who was released by the Raiders on Thursday, kissed a fellow player on the head and the teammate took offense to it, a source told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: 💍 Haliburton proposes to girlfriend Jade Jones
content: Haliburton staged the proposal inside Hilton Coliseum on the Iowa State campus, where the couple began dating.

title: Who will start for the Browns and Colts in Week 1? We made QB battle predictions
content: We talked to sources to help project open QB1 races in Cleveland, Indianapolis, New Orleans and New York.

title: 'Just a top-shelf human being': Teammates, opponents remember Ryne Sandberg
content: Beloved on and off the field, Sandberg leaves a lasting legacy in Chicago and throughout the baseball universe.

title: Which teams take the next step in 2025? We have 11 candidates
content: FSU has nowhere to go but up, Michigan can get way better, and Arizona State is building on its CFP berth. Which other teams are primed for bigger things in 2025?

title: Bronny James has big goals for Year 2. Will the young Laker achieve them?
content: After spending Year 1 working away from the spotlight, James hopes it'll translate into playing time with Los Angeles.

title: Power Rankings: Sparks, Valkyries headed in opposite directions
content: Los Angeles rides a win streak (and Cameron Brink's return) up the latest edition, and Golden State struggles.

title: WNBA trades we want to see: Mabrey to Storm, Hines-Allen to Fever
content: Marina Mabrey, Aaliyah Edwards and Myisha Hines-Allen could be on the move before the trade deadline.

title: 'I'm getting that true balance': Dak Prescott's perspective as a dad and longest-tenured Cowboy
content: The quarterback enters Year 10 with the Cowboys, and he is focused on health, family and winning a Super Bowl.

title: Six late-round 'fliers' who can help you win your league
content: Hitting on a player late in drafts can be a big boost -- to your team and your ego. Here are six "fliers" you need to be considering.

title: Clay's Playbook: A game plan for your draft day
content: Mike Clay goes position by position and lays out a successful approach for 2025 fantasy football drafts.

title: Way-Too-Early men's Bracketology: Houston is No. 1, and we'll have a new WAC champ
content: Grand Canyon moved up its timeline to switch from the WAC to the Mountain West, which significantly shifts the bracket dynamics.

title: Liverpool won the Premier League and now they're on a spending spree. Why?
content: Fresh off winning the Premier League with few reinforcements, Liverpool are now splashing the cash in the summer transfer window ahead of the 2025-26 season.

title: VAR Review: Ranking Euro 2025's biggest incidents
content: Video Assistant Referee always causes controversy, and that was no different at Euro 2025. So how were the decisions made?

title: Pelton's NBA offseason grades: Who aced their summer -- and who got the only 'F'
content: Kevin Pelton hands out offseason grades for each of the NBA's 30 teams. Who passed, and who scraped by?

title: Ranking every prospect dealt before the 2025 MLB trade deadline
content: You know the major leaguers on the move -- but what about the potential stars of tomorrow headed the other way in those deals?

title: Reactions to MLB trade deadline deals
content: Track the fantasy fallout from all the key deals as we head towards the MLB trade deadline on Thursday, July 31.

title: Why Liverpool still want Alexander Isak amid massive summer spending
content: Liverpool's pursuit of Alexander Isak amid a summer of big spending isn't about being better this season but about future-proofing the team so that they're ready for life beyond Mo Salah.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Newcastle eye Jackson to replace Liverpool-linked Isak
content: Newcastle's interest in Nicolas Jackson could open the way for Alexander Isak to join Liverpool. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Cincy on the up after tight draw vs. Messi-less Miami
content: Cincinnati is looking like one of the league's best again after taking the fight to Miami, climbing the latest edition of ESPN's MLS Power Rankings.

title: Ohio to Virginia: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 5 quiz
content: Did someone say sports trivia? As "SportsCenter" continues its summer road trip, we're back for our fifth "state check."

title: "This Government Clueless About What Deterrence Means": Rahul Gandhi
content: Hitting out at the government for its handling of Operation Sindoor, which was India's response to the Pahalgam terror attack, Leader of the Opposition in the Lok Sabha Rahul Gandhi has said the government lacked the political will to fight Pakistan.

title: Parliament Monsoon Session Day 7 Live Updates: "Operation Sindoor Will Continue": PM Modi's "Notice" To Pak
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh has opened 16-hour long special discussion on the Operation Sindoor in the Rajya Sabha.

title: "No World Leader Asked Us To Stop Op Sindoor": PM Modi On Congress' Trump Charge
content: Reiterating the government's stand that the ceasefire on May 10 was agreed to after Pakistan pleaded for one, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said no leader from any country had asked India to stop Operation Sindoor.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Counter View: A Clarification On Iran's Strategic Path And Historical Resolve
content: Iran always welcomed negotiation, provided to be fair and equal and its rights to be respected, and no nation should be expected to trade sovereignty for survival.

title: How Terrorists Killed In Op Mahadev Were Identified As Pahalgam Attackers
content: The recovery of foreign-made weapons from terrorists killed in a military operation yesterday has provided the Indian forces with undeniable evidence of an international conspiracy behind the terror impetus in Jammu and Kashmir, sources have said.

title: "Bas Karo, Bahut Maara": PM Modi Says Pak Begged For Ceasefire
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, during his response to the debate on Operation Sindoor in Lok Sabha, took jibes aplenty at Congress and mockingly described how Pakistan sued for peace.

title: UP Woman 'Murdered And Cremated' 15 Days After Giving Birth To Girl
content: A woman who had given birth to a girl just 15 days ago died under suspicious circumstances, with her family alleging she was murdered and cremated without their knowledge, police said on Tuesday.

title: US Team To Visit India On August 25 For Next Round Of Trade Talks
content: The US team will visit India on August 25 for the next round of negotiations for the proposed bilateral trade agreement between the two countries, an official said on Tuesday.

title: Battle Of Baghpat 2.0: Kulhads Fly As Mathura Lassi Sellers Fight On Street
content: The Battle of Baghpat in 2021 was fought over chaat. And the Battle of Mathura in July 2025 has been fought over lassi

title: "Will Step In": Top Court To Poll Body On Mass Exclusion In Bihar Rolls Revision
content: The Supreme Court said the Election Commission is a constitutional authority and it is deemed to act in accordance with law, but if there is mass exclusion in the special intensive revision of electoral rolls in Bihar, the court will step in

title: Meryl Streep, Anne Hathaway Narrowly Miss Manhattan Shooting That Killed 4
content: As gunmen Shane Devon Tamura went on a shooting spree in Manhattan on Monday, actresses Meryl Streep and Anne Hathaway had joined Stanley Tucci to film the Devil Wears Prada sequel just minutes away from the building.

title: "Sindoor Se Sindhu Tak...": PM Modi's Top Quotes In Parliament
content: Countering Rahul Gandhi's criticism that there was no "freedom of operation and manoeuvre for the armed forces" during Operation Sindoor, Prime Minister Narendra Modi today underlined that the government gave armed forces a free hand.

title: Rahul Gandhi Rakes Government Over Donald Trump's Lunch With Pak Army Chief
content: India's outreach to world leaders on Operation Sindoor and the message on Pakistani terror notwithstanding, US President Donald Trump had hosted Pak army chief Asim Munir at the White House last month, Congress's Rahul Gandhi said.

title: Women Accidentally Drives Car Into Ditch Near Mumbai, Rescued
content: The woman was supposed to take the Bay bridge in Belapur, but Google Maps navigated her through a route beneath the bridge - leading to Dhruvatara Jetty.

title: India-UK Trade Deal To Ease Access For Domestic Medical Devices In Britain
content: The India-UK trade pact has incorporated a mutual recognition agreement framework to facilitate smoother entry of medical devices certified by domestic regulatory agencies into the British market, an official said on Tuesday.

title: JP Nadda Apologises After Uproar On "Mental Balance" Remark On M Kharge
content: Union minister JP Nadda, whose "lost his mental balance" remark about Conngress chief Mallikarjun Kharge sparked a tumult in the Lok Sabha during the discussion on Operation Sindoor, has apologized to the Congress chief.

title: Delhi Court Upholds Medha Patkar's Conviction In Defamation Case
content: The Delhi High Court on Tuesday upheld the conviction and punishment awarded to activist Medha Patkar in a defamation case filed by Delhi LG V K Saxena.

title: 4 Men Arrested For Stealing 548 Grams Of Gold In Bengaluru: Cops
content: Four people were arrested for stealing 548 grams of gold ornaments from a house and selling them. The Kothanur police have recovered a total of Rs 10 lakhs in cash from them, police said on Tuesday.

title: Mumbai Police Bust Rs 2 Crore Tramadol Racket; 3 Arrested With "ISIS Drug"
content: The Mumbai Police's Anti Narcotics Cell (ANC) arrested three people in the Andheri JB circle area for possessing over Rs two crore worth of the "ISIS drug" Tramadol tablets, police officials said on Tuesday.

title: Yellow Alert Issued For Heavy Rain, Thunderstorms In Parts Of Uttarakhand
content: A yellow alert for heavy rain has been issued in some districts of Uttarakhand on Tuesday, according to the Indian Meteorological Department (IMD).

title: 'Old habit': PM Modi slams Congress' 'negative approach' on strikes against Pak
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi attacked the Congress party in Parliament. He accused them of questioning army operations. Modi cited instances like the surgical strikes and Balakot airstrikes. He said Congress demanded proof and photographic evidence. Modi highlighted the return of pilot Abhinandan and a BSF jawan. He praised India's air defense system.

title: IND vs ENG: The Oval's last game had 1444 runs, 6 hundreds and a triple ton
content: The India-England Test series heads to a decisive finale at The Oval, where the toss could heavily influence the match, given the venue's recent high-scoring history. Surrey's mammoth 820/9 declared against Durham, featuring multiple centuries, raises questions about batting first.

title: 'Congress importing issues from Pakistan,' says PM Modi in LS - top quotes
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi asserted in Lok Sabha that India swiftly retaliated against the April 22 Pahalgam attack in just 22 minutes during Operation Sindoor. He accused the Congress party of being under Pakistan's influence and lacking the will to confront Pakistan's military infrastructure, highlighting India's strengthened defense capabilities and decisive actions against terrorism.

title: US Senator to Elon Musk: Block Starlink in Southeast Asia's 'criminal compounds'
content: Senator Maggie Hassan has raised concerns about Starlink's use by criminal organizations in Southeast Asia to perpetrate scams against Americans, resulting in billions of dollars in losses. She urges Elon Musk to take action, citing UN reports and law enforcement data indicating widespread misuse of the satellite internet service in scam compounds.

title: 'Exercise to protect PM's image': Rahul on Op Sindoor; dares Modi to call Trump 'liar'
content: During the Operation Sindoor debate, Rahul Gandhi fiercely criticized PM Modi, alleging the exercise was to protect his image. Gandhi challenged Modi to refute Trump's claims about trade leverage and downed fighter jets. He questioned Modi's silence on Trump's meeting with Pakistan General Asim Munir, linked to the Pahalgam attack.

title: IND vs ENG: Broad: 'Stokes was right to take his cap off and offer handshake'
content: Stuart Broad defends Ben Stokes' offer to shake hands in the drawn fourth Test, acknowledging both sides' perspectives. Stokes, exhausted after 143 overs, sought to end the match, while Jadeja and Sundar, nearing centuries, rightfully pursued their milestones. Broad highlights the unique situation where both captain and batters had valid reasons for their actions in the game's final moments.

title: IND vs ENG | Gautam Gambhir vs curator fight: A complete timeline
content: Tensions flared ahead of the final India-England Test as Indian head coach Gautam Gambhir engaged in a heated exchange with Oval curator Lee Fortis. The disagreement arose from restrictions placed on the Indian team's access to the pitch, specifically regarding the distance they were allowed to stand and the curator's objections to their presence.

title: Accenture executive says AI can speed up work, but won’t raise productivity unless…
content: Artificial Intelligence tools can speed up tasks. However, Accenture's Ramine Tinati says it doesn't guarantee productivity. Companies need to redesign workflows for real gains. Some Asian firms are lagging in AI adoption. Tech giants like Amazon and Microsoft are investing heavily in AI. Nvidia's Jensen Huang and OpenAI's Sam Altman believe AI will change jobs.

title: Nadda vs Kharge sparks RS uproar; BJP chief withdraws remark, apologises
content: Rajya Sabha witnessed uproar as JP Nadda and Mallikarjun Kharge clashed during a debate on Operation Sindoor and the Pahalgam attack. Nadda's remark accusing Kharge of losing mental balance ignited protests, leading to demands for retraction. Despite initial resistance, Nadda apologized but urged for expunging Kharge's remarks against Prime Minister Modi.

title: Copper wig incident: Fan crosses line in courtside clash; spectator ejected from arena; viral
content: During a recent WNBA game between the Phoenix Mercury and the Washington Mystics, an unexpected incident occurred when Kahleah Copper's wig was accidentally pulled off by Jade Melbourne. The game was briefly paused as Copper left the court. Later, a fan was ejected after Mercury players alerted officials to the fan's inappropriate behavior following the incident.

title: 'Tough to join': Rahane on Dhruv Jurel ahead of fifth Test at The Oval
content: Veteran batter Ajinkya Rahane lauded young wicketkeeper Dhruv Jurel for his solid performance in the fourth Test against England, stepping in after Rishabh Pant's injury. Rahane highlighted the difficulty of wicketkeeping in English conditions, praising Jurel's composure and valuable suggestions to captain and players.

title: Bryan Johnson is planning to shut down or sell his anti-aging startup?
content: Bryan Johnson, the millionaire behind Project Blueprint, is considering shutting down or selling his anti-aging startup due to philosophical conflicts and difficulties in scaling his personalized protocols. He feels the business undermines his credibility in the philosophical space and distracts from his focus on 'Don't Die,' a belief system centered on radical life extension.

title: 'First time in history ... ': Priyanka slams PM on Trump 'announcing' ceasefire
content: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra attacked Prime Minister Narendra Modi regarding the ceasefire announcement made by US President Donald Trump. She questioned the government's accountability and accused them of prioritizing politics over public interest. Gandhi Vadra referenced Operation Sindoor and the understanding reached between India and Pakistan to end the conflict.

title: 'Played crucial role in eliminating cowardly terrorists': PM Modi hails Op Mahadev
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi lauded the armed forces for Operation Mahadev, which successfully neutralized three terrorists involved in the Pahalgam attack in Srinagar, Jammu and Kashmir. Union Home Minister Amit Shah informed the Lok Sabha that the operation eliminated Suleman, Afghan, and Jibran, all A-category terrorists.

title: TCS layoffs: Amidst mass sackings, firm stops salary hikes & senior level hiring
content: TCS is freezing experienced hiring and global salary hikes amidst concerns over slow demand and AI's impact, potentially cutting 12,000 jobs. This move, impacting cities like Hyderabad and Chennai, sparks industry-wide discussions and worries about a talent "bloodbath."

title: Vanessa Bryant shows love on Ciara’s joyful family post with Russell Wilson
content: Vanessa Bryant showed her support for Russell Wilson's family by commenting on Ciara's Instagram post, which featured the family cheering Wilson at training camp. This gesture highlights the strong bond between Vanessa and Ciara, who have supported each other through various life events, including Kobe Bryant's passing. Their families share a close friendship, celebrating milestones and vacations together.

title: Patrick Mahomes Sr. gets travel pass to cheer son in Arizona game
content: Patrick Mahomes Sr., facing probation for a felony DWI charge, has received court approval to travel from Texas to Arizona. He plans to attend the Kansas City Chiefs' preseason game against the Arizona Cardinals on August 9, 2025, in Glendale. A Smith County judge granted the request, allowing Mahomes Sr. to support his son, Patrick Mahomes, at the game.

title: Gabrielle Union reveals daughter Kaavia obsessed with marriage on vacation
content: Gabrielle Union shared a humorous anecdote about her daughter Kaavia's obsession with marriage during a family vacation in Hawaii. Kaavia, enamored with her best friend Crosby, declared him her husband without his knowledge, leading to comical and awkward situations throughout the trip. Union highlighted Kaavia's bold personality and the family's tradition of escaping to Hawaii for Christmas.

title: IND vs ENG: The Oval curator shares his version after exchange with Gambhir
content: A heated exchange occurred between India head coach Gautam Gambhir and The Oval curator Lee Fortis regarding practice pitch conditions, prompting intervention from batting coach Sitanshu Kotak. Fortis remained tight-lipped about the specifics of the disagreement. In team news, Arshdeep Singh is set to make his Test debut as India aims to level the series against England in the fifth and final Test.

title: 'Only vidaai is left': Rajasthan MP’s quirky take on Operation Sindoor and Pakistan — watch
content: During a Parliament discussion on Operation Sindoor, Nagaur MP Hanuman Beniwal likened Pakistan to India's "wife," sparking laughter and controversy. His remark followed Union Home Minister Amit Shah's statement on the successful operations against terrorists involved in the Pahalgam attack, emphasizing Pakistani involvement.

title: India-US trade deal: As Donald Trump's deadline nears, more talks needed
content: With Trump's tariffs looming, Indian and American officials are in intense discussions to find common ground on customs duties. Despite USTR Jamieson Greer indicating further talks are necessary and a trade deal unlikely soon, officials haven't dismissed a last-minute breakthrough. The next round of talks is scheduled for August 25.

title: Linda Hogan: 'I won’t attend Hulk’s funeral'; claims Brooke won’t either
content: In a shocking turn, Linda Hogan posted a video alleging Brooke Hogan wouldn't attend Hulk Hogan's funeral, citing past trauma and family issues. The wrestling world mourns Hulk Hogan, who passed away on July 24, 2025, from cardiac arrest. However, the video featuring Brooke was later revealed as an AI-generated fake, sparking further controversy.

title: NFL HQ shooting: Shane Tamura let one woman flee before targeting his next victims
content: Shane Tamura from Las Vegas caused a deadly shooting in Manhattan. The incident occurred at 345 Park Avenue. Tamura killed four people, including officer Didarul Islam. He used an M4 rifle. Tamura had driven from Las Vegas, crossing several states. Authorities confirmed his history of mental health issues. The shooting has sparked debates on gun control and mental health support.

title: IND vs ENG: Gambhir vs Oval curator: Batting coach reveals 'silly' reason
content: Tensions flared between India's head coach Gautam Gambhir and The Oval's pitch curator Lee Fortis during a training session, sparked by disagreements over pitch access and conduct. The situation escalated, requiring intervention from India's batting coach. This incident follows a series of on-field disagreements throughout the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy series, highlighting the intense atmosphere surrounding the matches.

title: EXCLUSIVE | IND vs ENG: Arshdeep all set to make his Test debut at Oval
content: Arshdeep Singh is poised to make his Test debut for India in the fifth Test against England, having recovered from a hand injury. The team management had planned to include him in the previous Tests, and his inclusion will likely lead to a rejig of the bowling combination, potentially alongside Mohammed Siraj and Akash Deep.

title: 'Jinki nimbo mirchi laga kar...': Akhilesh takes 'Rafale' jibe at govt in LS
content: Akhilesh Yadav, Samajwadi Party chief, questioned the government about Operation Sindoor in Lok Sabha. He claimed India fought a war against China, not Pakistan. Yadav inquired about the number of aircraft used and criticized the handling of the Pulwama attack investigation. He also accused the BJP of politicizing delegation member selections and questioned the current surface area of India.

title: ‘Saiyaara’ box office: Ahaan Panday, Aneet Padda film has a slow start on second Tuesday
content: Saiyaara continues its successful run at the box office, breaking records in its second week. Despite a minor drop on weekdays, the film earned Rs 30 crore on its second Sunday. Second Monday collections were Rs 9.25 crore, and Tuesday afternoon saw Rs 1.6 crore. The total collection now stands at Rs 258.17 crore.

title: IND vs ENG: Gambhir gets into massive fight with The Oval's ground staff; staff required to step in
content: Tensions flared at The Oval as Team India head coach Gautam Gambhir clashed with the groundstaff over alleged inadequate practice facilities. The heated argument, which involved raised voices and finger-pointing, required intervention from the Indian support staff. India go into the fifth Test trailing England 1-2.

title: 'India expected to miss Rohit, but KL Rahul is playing like a tapasvi'
content: KL Rahul has shone brightly in the Test series against England, effectively filling the void left by Rohit Sharma. He has amassed 511 runs, including two centuries, averaging an impressive 63.88. Aakash Chopra lauded Rahul's disciplined approach and vital contributions with Yashasvi Jaiswal, ensuring India hasn't felt Rohit's absence at the top.

title: EU sanctions hit! Microsoft suspends services at Indian refinery- see details
content: Hit by EU sanctions, the Russia-backed Nayara Energy refinery in India has switched to a local IT company after Microsoft discontinued its services. Nayara, partly owned by Rosneft, is challenging Microsoft's decision in court, arguing the sanctions are affecting its operations and access to crucial data.

title: 'Voter IDs, chocolates ...': Amit Shah lists proof Pahalgam terrorists came from Pak
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah announced in Lok Sabha that security forces neutralized three terrorists involved in the Pahalgam attack during Operation Mahadev. The terrorists, identified as Suleman, Afghan, and Jibran, were A-category members of Lashkar-e-Taiba. Investigation involved questioning over a thousand individuals, creating composite sketches, and detaining those who provided food and shelter to the terrorists.

title: 'We have proof': Shah slams Chidambaram's 'homegrown' terrorists remark; asks whom does he want to save?
content: In a Lok Sabha showdown, Amit Shah strongly refuted P Chidambaram's doubts regarding Pakistan's role in the Pahalgam terror attack and Operation Sindoor. Shah presented evidence, including NIA arrests and FSL reports, confirming the terrorists' identities and their Pakistani origin. He accused Chidambaram of giving Pakistan a clean chit and undermining the investigation.

title: Caught on cam: Woman reverses SUV into glass door at Bareilly hotel; panic erupts in lobby
content: In Bareilly, a woman accidentally crashed her SUV through the glass entrance of Hotel Ramada after dinner with her husband. While reversing, she mistakenly accelerated, causing the vehicle to surge backward. The SUV shattered the entrance and rammed into the reception area, creating chaos and property damage, though no injuries were reported.

title: 'Ill-timed': US shuns UN 2-state solution conference; conveys concerns with India
content: The United States has expressed reservations to India regarding the UN 2-state conference, deeming it counterproductive to ending the Gaza conflict and securing hostage releases. Despite US urging, India is participating, seeking constructive engagement towards a 2-state solution. India balances its ties with Israel and its support for the Palestinian cause, advocating for a negotiated resolution.

title: ‘Negotiations needed…’: Trump official on India-US trade; no deal before Aug 1?
content: India-US trade deal: Hopes for an imminent India-US trade deal are fading as a top American official indicates that more negotiations are needed before President Trump's August 1 tariff deadline. Despite ongoing discussions, disagreements persist, particularly in agriculture and dairy sectors, where India remains protective.

title: 'If you don't understand my silence ...': Fresh rift within Congress? Manish Tewari post adds to speculation
content: Congress MP Manish Tewari's cryptic social media posts have ignited speculation about internal divisions within the party, particularly regarding national security issues. His silence during a crucial Lok Sabha debate on Operation Sindoor, coupled with Shashi Tharoor's abstention and reported internal criticism, suggests a lack of unified stance within the Congress leadership.

title: NASA-ISRO to launch NISAR on July 30: $1.5B satellite to track climate; GSLV-F16 to make debut
content: The NASA-ISRO Synthetic Aperture Radar (NISAR) satellite, a joint Earth observation mission, is scheduled to launch on July 30, 2025. This collaboration between India and the US will provide high-resolution, all-weather imagery for disaster management, climate monitoring, and more. NISAR's open-data policy aims to empower global decision-making and emergency response efforts.

title: 'What if Duckett was on 90?: Ex-cricketer slams England over handshake drama
content: Parthiv Patel questions the 'spirit of the game' after England offered a handshake to India during the fourth Test, with Jadeja and Sundar nearing centuries. He wonders if England would have accepted a similar offer if Ben Duckett was close to his century. Patel supports India's decision to continue batting, emphasising their hard-earned position and the right to pursue milestones.

title: 'Absolute filth, embarrassing moment': Stuart Broad on Harry Brook's over where he bowled 37mph
content: Stuart Broad criticized England's tactics during the fourth Test against India, particularly Harry Brook's off-spin bowling, labeling it "embarrassing." Ben Stokes's attempt to speed up the match's conclusion by using Brook and bringing fielders in close drew scrutiny. While opinions diverged, the incident highlights the tension and debate surrounding England's approach as the series heads to a decisive final Test.

title: Jason Kelce jokes about Travis’ Happy Gilmore 2 role in post with their dad
content: Jason Kelce shared a photo with Adam Sandler, his dad, and Travis Kelce. Travis has a cameo in Netflix's Happy Gilmore 2. Jason congratulated Sandler for reviving the classic movie. He also praised Travis for his role as a waiter. The film features a comedic scene. Adam Sandler lauded Kelce's performance. Happy Gilmore 2 is now streaming on Netflix.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Why not declare after Ben Stokes' hundred?' - Sunil Gavaskar slams England's 'loud talk'
content: The drawn Test match between India and England saw heated exchanges. Sunil Gavaskar has now criticized England's tactics. He praised India's resilience, especially Ravindra Jadeja and Washington Sundar's batting. Gavaskar questioned England's delayed declaration. He also referenced past comments from England players about chasing high scores. Gavaskar challenged Shubman Gill to question England's strategy in the post-match conference.

title: TCS layoffs: IT ministry ‘closely monitoring’ 12k job cuts, claims report
content: India's IT Ministry is closely monitoring TCS's plan to reduce its workforce by over 12,000 employees, primarily impacting middle and senior management. This restructuring, representing two percent of TCS's global staff, is part of a strategy to become a "future-ready organisation.

title: NFL under pressure to review safety measures after New York shooting; 5 killed; league faces calls for urgent action
content: A gunman's deadly rampage at the NFL's New York headquarters triggered a lockdown and claimed a police officer's life, shaking the league's operations. While no players or executives were harmed, the incident prompted immediate security enhancements and internal discussions about the future of the NFL's presence in Midtown Manhattan, including exploring options like remote work and relocation.

title: RBI bets on gold! Central Bank buys half a tonne of gold in June
content: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) increased its gold reserves by approximately half a tonne in late June, bringing total holdings to 879.8 tonnes. Gold's value within India's foreign exchange reserves has significantly increased, reaching 12.1% as of July 18, 2025.

title: Don't stop believing: The inside story of how England won Euro 2025
content: the Lionesses were draped in gold-and-silver ticker tape as basel danced to the echo of 2022 and the new heroines of 2025 . they were the first team to win two major tournaments, and the first on foreign soil . as the celebrations began after the penalty shootout win over Spain , Lucy Bronze was hopping on one leg .

content: training camps have kicked off around the NFL . the latest intel on standouts, highlights, position battles, depth chart movement, cut decisions and, of course, the quarterback room . follow the links below to learn everything we are seeing and hearing at camp .

title: Brock Purdy and wife, Jenna, announce birth of first child
content: Purdy's wife, Jenna, gave birth to the couple's first child, millie Joleen . the 49ers' new arrival came nearly two weeks after star running back Christian McCaffrey and his wife had their first child .

title: 'He called me several times but ... ': PM on his call with US VP during Op Sindoor
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: 'It's about standards and details': Man United, Amorim aiming to start anew
content: Ruben Amorim arrived in the us for man united's preseason tour with a smile back on his face . he snapped back at reporters who suggested the performance had been poor . but time back in Portugal has allowed for a reset and at the start of a pivotal summer for the club .
